column1: Kata Robata////Kata has a happy hour
column2: even on the weekend. Love it. And the happy hour menu does change. Try the kobe beef. Delicious. The rolls are ok and good size. Favorite roll was the spicy tuna. Order the sashimi platter. Not bad. Firm texture. No fishy smell. Other places
column3: I can smell and can taste old fish. Here
column4: Kata keeps fresh or semi fresh fish.
